column2: also known as the '''Elendil Stone''' was one of the [[Palantíri]] brought by the [[Faithful]] from [[Númenor]].

column1: It was stored in the tower [[Elostirion]] on the [[Emyn Beraid]] by [[Elendil]]
column2: and in later years was guarded by [[Círdan]] and the [[Elves]] of [[Lindon]].{{fact}}

column1: The stone was aligned westwards towards the [[Master-stone]] in the [[Tower of Avallonë]]
column2: along the length of the [[Straight Road]]; because of this
column3: it could not communicate with the other six of [[Middle-earth]]. Only Elendil was able to use it to look west across the [[Belegaer|Sea]] and see the [[Undying Lands]];<ref>{{S|Rings}}</ref>  Elendil also tried to see the fallen Númenor with the stone but failed.

column2: [[Wandering Companies]] of Elves made pilgrimages to visit the Towers and see the Stone
column3: in order to catch a glimpse of [[Varda]]. One such company
column4: led by [[Gildor|Gildor Inglorion]] just returning from Elostirion

column1: It remained in its tower until the end of the [[Third Age]]; it was then taken back into the West aboard the [[White Ship]].<ref>{{RK|Havens}}</ref>
